sub_topic: Quantification of the amount of a substance in a sample using potentiometry
message_1: What is the concentration of sodium ions in a 0.5M solution of NaCl using a sodium-selective electrode?
message_2:
A sodium-selective electrode is used to measure the concentration of sodium ions in a solution. In a 0.5M NaCl solution, the concentration of sodium ions (Na+) is equal to the concentration of chloride ions (Cl-), which is also 0.5M.

So, the concentration of sodium ions in a 0.5M NaCl solution is 0.5M.
